page.title: 14MEMORIAL HALL AND SPORTS
page.content: Built in 1922. Contains memorial to those from Catforth who died in two wars. In a Trust Deed stipulated by the donors of the land the hall cannot be used on a Sunday or alcohol drunk on the premises. There are 70 members 7 of whom are trustees and 18 form a management group. A president is chosen annually from the members. Club bowling finals held on presidents day in July are watched by representatives of neighbouring clubs who stay for tea 6 crown green bowling teams compete in local leagues from April _ Sept and open competitions are organised for men, women and juniors. 1 snooker team plays in a league Sept/Mar.Pool, table tennis and darts are also played. Whist and domino drives are held each week and bingo monthly. The football clubs 2 teams play in the summer league on land given by Tom Barron.
